posts.post_content:
If you add [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim) to that, you end up with  
[Kederekt Parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kederekt Parasite) + [Underworld Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Underworld Dreams) + [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood) + [Burning Inquiry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Inquiry) + [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim)  
  
If you have all of those down, on one turn they will take 2 from the initial draw, 6 from Signing, 12 from Burning Inquiry. 20 damage. But still, five card combo. Underworld and 2 Megrims with Inquiry would deal 15 damage.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: You don't need a Mono Black to use this. My deck which is based on it is 3 colors, and it works just fine, allowing a first or second turn win with the right opening hand. And now that all those sissy house rules are actually rules now (Like Mulligans, which used to be a House Rule, and not legal, are now allowed) you can basically shuffle until your hand doesn't suck if you're willing to drop a card each time.

posts.post_content:
I've had a lot of fun with this and [Teferi's Puzzle Box](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi's Puzzle Box), combined with [Psychic Possession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Psychic Possession) (this is the only combo I've ever found for this card!) and control spells like [Sunder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunder) and [Wash Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wash Out). Makes for a medium power, medium speed combo that's a lot of fun, and can finish hard.  
  
Dark rits, filter lands, or [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) will help you get this into play more reliably. Nothing like a first turn Dreams with a dark rit tho. That just puts a ticking clock up on your opponent's game.
posts.html:
I've had a lot of fun with this and Teferi's Puzzle Box, combined with Psychic Possession (this is the only combo I've ever found for this card!) and control spells like Sunder and Wash Out. Makes for a medium power, medium speed combo that's a lot of fun, and can finish hard.

Dark rits, filter lands, or Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth will help you get this into play more reliably. Nothing like a first turn Dreams with a dark rit tho. That just puts a ticking clock up on your opponent's game.
